<div id="t1_1" class="t m1_1 s1_1">U.S. Department of Labor</div>
<div id="t2_1" class="t m1_1 s2_1">Occupational Safety and Health Administration</div>
<div id="t3_1" class="t m2_1 s3_1">OSHA's Form 300</div>
<div id="t4_1" class="t m2_1 s4_1">(Rev. 01/2004)</div>
<div id="t5_1" class="t m2_1 s5_1">Year 20__ __</div>
<div id="t6_1" class="t m3_1 s6_1">Log of Work-Related Injuries and Illnesses</div>
<div id="t7_1" class="t s7_1">You must record information about every work-related death and about every work-related injury or illness that involves loss of consciousness, restricted work activity or job transfer,</div>
<div id="t8_1" class="t s7_1">days away from work, or medical treatment beyond first aid. You must also record significant work-related injuries and illnesses that are diagnosed by a physician or licensed health</div>
<div id="t9_1" class="t s7_1">care professional. You must also record work-related injuries and illnesses that meet any of the specific recording criteria listed in 29 CFR Part 1904.8 through 1904.12. Feel free to</div>
<div id="ta_1" class="t s7_1">use two lines for a single case if you need to. You must complete an Injury and Illness Incident Report (OSHA Form 301) or equivalent form for each injury or illness recorded on this</div>
<div id="tb_1" class="t s7_1">form. If you're not sure whether a case is recordable, call your local OSHA office for help.</div>
<div id="tc_1" class="t s8_1">Form approved OMB no. 1218-0176</div>
<div id="td_1" class="t m1_1 s9_1">Page ____ of ____</div>
<div id="te_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">Skin disorder</div>
<div id="tf_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">Respiratory</div>
<div id="tg_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">condition</div>
<div id="th_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">Poisoning</div>
<div id="ti_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">Hearing loss</div>
<div id="tj_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">All other</div>
<div id="tk_1" class="t m4_1 s10_1">illnesses</div>
<div id="tl_1" class="t s11_1">Be sure to transfer these totals to the Summary page (Form 300A) before you post it.</div>
<div id="tm_1" class="t m1_1 s12_1">Page totals</div>
<div id="tn_1" class="t s13_1">Establishment name ___________________________________________</div>
<div id="to_1" class="t s13_1">City ________________________________ </div>
<div id="tp_1" class="t s13_1">State ___________________</div>
<div id="tq_1" class="t m4_1 s14_1">Injury</div>
<div id="tr_1" class="t m5_1 s15_1">Enter the number of</div>
<div id="ts_1" class="t m5_1 s15_1">days the injured or</div>
<div id="tt_1" class="t m5_1 s15_1">ill worker was:</div>
<div id="tu_1" class="t m1_1 s16_1">Check the "Injury" column or</div>
<div id="tv_1" class="t m1_1 s16_1">choose one type of illness:</div>
<div id="tw_1" class="t s17_1">month/day</div>

<div id="t19_1" class="t s8_1">Public reporting burden for this collection of information is estimated to average 14 minutes per response, including time to review</div>
<div id="t1a_1" class="t s8_1">the instructions, search and gather the data needed, and complete and review the collection of information. Persons are not required</div>
<div id="t1b_1" class="t s8_1">to respond to the collection of information unless it displays a currently valid OMB control number. If you have any comments</div>
<div id="t1c_1" class="t s8_1">about these estimates or any other aspects of this data collection, contact: US Department of Labor, OSHA Office of Statistical</div>
<div id="t1d_1" class="t s8_1">Analysis, Room N-3644, 200 Constitution Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20210. Do not send the completed forms to this office.</div>

<div id="t21_1" class="t s22_1">This form contains information relating to</div>
<div id="t22_1" class="t s22_1">employee health and must be used in a manner that</div>
<div id="t23_1" class="t s22_1">protects the confidentiality of employees to the extent</div>

<div id="t25_1" class="t s22_1">occupational safety and health purposes.</div>
